definitions.definition: Act or instance of running, of moving rapidly using the feet.
definitions.example: I just got back from my morning run.

definitions.definition: Act or instance of hurrying (to or from a place) (not necessarily by foot); dash or errand, trip.
definitions.example: I need to make a run to the store.

definitions.definition: A pleasure trip.
definitions.example: Let's go for a run in the car.

definitions.definition: Flight, instance or period of fleeing.
Migration (of fish).
A group of fish that migrate, or ascend a river for the purpose of spawning.
A path taken by literal movement or figuratively
An enclosure for an animal; a track or path along which something can travel.
definitions.example: He set up a rabbit run.

definitions.definition: Rural landholding for farming, usually for running sheep, and operated by a runholder.
State of being current; currency; popularity.
Continuous or sequential
A flow of liquid; a leak.
definitions.example: The constant run of water from the faucet annoys me.

definitions.definition: (West Virginia) A small creek or part thereof. (Compare Southern US branch and New York and New England brook.)
definitions.example: The military campaign near that creek was known as "The battle of Bull Run".

definitions.definition: A quick pace, faster than a walk.
A sudden series of demands on a bank or other financial institution, especially characterised by great withdrawals.
definitions.example: Financial insecurity led to a run on the banks, as customers feared for the security of their savings.

definitions.definition: Any sudden large demand for something.
definitions.example: There was a run on Christmas presents.

definitions.definition: Various horizontal dimensions or surfaces
A standard or unexceptional group or category.
definitions.example: He stood out from the usual run of applicants.

definitions.definition: In sports
A line of knit stitches that have unravelled, particularly in a nylon stocking.
definitions.example: I have a run in my stocking.

definitions.definition: The stern of the underwater body of a ship from where it begins to curve upward and inward.

The horizontal distance to which a drift may be carried, either by licence of the proprietor of a mine or by the nature of the formation; also, the direction which a vein of ore or other substance takes.
A pair or set of millstones.
(usually in the phrase 'do a runner') A quick escape away from a scene.
definitions.example: He did a runner after robbing the drugstore.

definitions.definition: A deserter.
A type of soft-soled shoe originally intended for runners.
Part of a shoe that is stitched to the bottom of the upper so it can be glued to the sole.
A part of an apparatus that moves quickly.
definitions.example: After the cycle completes, the runner travels back quickly to be in place for the next cycle.

definitions.definition: A mechanical part intended to guide or aid something else to move (using wheels or sliding).
An automobile; a working or driveable automobile.
definitions.example: Is that old Mercedes on the forecourt a runner? / No, it has no gearbox.

definitions.definition: A strip of fabric used to decorate or protect a table or dressing table.
definitions.example: The red runner makes the table so festive.

definitions.definition: A long, narrow carpet for a high traffic area such as a hall or stairs.
definitions.example: How about we put down a clear runner in the front hall.

definitions.definition: A part of a cigarette that is burning unevenly.
A long stolon sent out by a plant (such as strawberry), in order to root new plantlets, or a plant that propagates by using such runners.
A short sling with a carabiner on either end, used to link the climbing rope to a bolt or other protection such as a nut or friend.
A competitor in a poker tournament.
A restaurant employee responsible for taking food from the kitchens to the tables.
A leaping food fish (Elagatis pinnulatis) of Florida and the West Indies; the skipjack, shoemaker, or yellowtail.
(sports slang) An employee of a sports agent who tries to recruit possible player clients for the agent.
A rope to increase the power of a tackle.
A speedrunner.
An idea or plan that has potential to be adopted or put into operation.
definitions.example: This idea isn't a runner. Let's not waste any more time on it.
